from pyfrid.modules.system.auth.core.auth import BaseAuthModule, User


[docs]class BaseNoAuthModule(BaseAuthModule):
    """
    This is authentication module which doesn't perform any login and logout and all access validations will return True.
    Use it if you don't need any authentication control in your application.
    """
    

[docs]    def validate_user(self,login,password):
        """Returns empty user."""
        return User("","")
    


[docs]    def validate_access(self,*args, **kwargs):
        """Always returns True"""
        return True
    


[docs]    def add_user(self, login, password, groups, name, email, organization):
        """Raises NotImplementedError."""
        raise NotImplementedError("No valid authentication module in the system")
    


[docs]    def del_user(self, login):
        """Raises NotImplementedError."""
        raise NotImplementedError("No valid authentication module in the system")
    


[docs]    def user_exists(self, login):
        """Raises NotImplementedError."""
        raise NotImplementedError("No valid authentication module in the system")
    

    def status(self):
        return None
    
    @property

[docs]    def noauth(self):
        """Returns True"""
        return True
